author: Syndicated Content
title: Bold and Bright Festival Back For Second Year of Winter Fun
text:
[vc_row gap=‚Äù20‚Ä≥][vc_column width=‚Äù3/4‚Ä≥][vc_column_text]
(KNSI) ‚Äì Some view winter as something to flee, but event planners in northern cities like St. Cloud increasingly recognize it as a draw that can lure visitors.
St. Cloud Downtown Alliance Director Rachel Lolmasteymaugh says for those who make the trek to central Minnesota for Bold and Bright this weekend, the fun they will have often turns into a viral social media moment.
‚ÄúPeople will come here; they want to feel the cold, they want to see the snow. We have ice sculptures that will be out. That is a huge draw! The amount of selfies that come from those ice sculptures. And what is great is we can go back on social media and see them posted all over for people just coming to the event.‚Äù
Bold and Bright starts Friday with an art crawl. On Saturday, there will be everything from curling on Lake George to a maker‚Äôs market and a lighted parade. A special emphasis is being placed on family-friendly entertainment.
The Paramount Center for the Arts is showing the film ‚ÄúHappy Feet‚Äù for free at 2:00 p.m. Lolmasteymaugh encourages you to stick around for a second kid-centric event.
‚ÄúAt 4:00, you can come in to the lobby of the Paramount and meet all the local mascots. I‚Äôm talking about the Texas Roadhouse armadillo, Blizzard, Chisel from the Rox. We have the dairy princess from Minnesota.‚Äù
Sunday is Game Day. Several downtown businesses will host trivia, putt-putt, and even Magic The Gathering. The full schedule is available here .
___

author: Cadena SER
title: As√≠ es la forma con la que una anciana ha descrito sus "s√≠ntomas" en una nota que ha emocionado en las redes | Actualidad | Cadena SER
text: [Sociedad](/actualidad/sociedad/) As√≠ es la forma con la que una anciana ha descrito sus "s√≠ntomas" en una nota que ha emocionado en las redes Una usuaria de las redes ha compartido con sus seguidores las anotaciones que realiza su abuela para indicar a su m√©dico que se encuentra en perfecto estado de salud tras una operaci√≥n de coraz√≥n Madrid Tras una operaci√≥n se les recomienda a los pacientes tener un control de sus s√≠ntomas y las sensaciones que experimentan despu√©s de la intervenci√≥n durante un determinado periodo de tiempo. Este es el caso de la abuela de una usuaria de la red social X (antes Twitter). M√°s informaci√≥n La joven ha compartido con sus seguidores de las redes lo que hace su abuela despu√©s de que le pusieran un Holter en el coraz√≥n. Seg√∫n explica la joven, la anciana anota todo lo que hace durante el d√≠a. Ella comienza a apuntar todo lo que hace a partir de la una de la tarde, desde preparar la comida hasta cuando se encuentra "descansando", todo "sin s√≠ntomas" si no se tiene en cuenta el "sill√≥n en la terraza". Las anotaciones han emocionado a los usuarios de las redes al leer como la abuela va tomando nota sobre sus horas de "descanso" sus compras en el supermercado o el rato en el que se encuentra "viendo la televisi√≥n". Entre todas las actividades, lo que m√°s ha llamado la atenci√≥n en las redes es lo que se encontraba haciendo la anciana a las 22.00h, "en el cable una pel√≠cula muy buena con Julia Roberts", algo que como se ha molestado en detallar, "le gust√≥ mucho".

author: UK News
title: Thousands of homes remain without power in wake of Storm Gerrit | Express & Star
text: Thousands of homes remain without power in wake of Storm Gerrit The Met Office confirmed the worst of the conditions passed. Thousands of homes remain without power as the post-storm cleanup begins in the wake of Storm Gerrit. Around 1,500 homes in Scotland experienced their second night without power in Scotland while a lightning strike hit supplies in Wales on Thursday. Power company Scottish and Southern Electricity Networks said it had restored supply to more than 46,000 properties that lost power due to the storm, with people in the north east and Shetland worst affected. They said the remaining homes should be reconnected on Friday with welfare vans serving hot food and drink to affected customers from 9am. Operations director Andy Smith said: ‚ÄúThis has been a difficult couple of days for the communities affected and I‚Äôm grateful to them for their patience and support as our teams work extremely hard to restore power.‚Äù National Grid UK said 36,000 properties were without power in Ceredigion on Thursday after lightning struck. Three men died after their 4√ó4 vehicle was submerged in the River Esk, near Glaisdale, on Thursday, North Yorkshire Police said. A supercell thunderstorm moved across the northwest of England on Thursday after a similar storm is thought to have resulted in a tornado that damaged homes in Greater Manchester on Wednesday. Around 100 properties were damaged by what police called a ‚Äúlocalised tornado‚Äù in Stalybridge, Tameside and in the badly-hit village of Carrbrook. Hayley McCaffer, 40, who lives in Carrbrook, told the PA news agency that some of her neighbours‚Äô houses ‚Äúare an absolute disaster‚Äù with missing roofs and ‚Äúsquished‚Äù cars. Damage will be covered by standard property insurance policies, the Association of British Insurers has said. ScotRail said many lines have been reopened but urged passengers to check for the latest information before travelling, a message echoed by LNER, Avanti West Coast and London Northwestern Railway who suspensed or cancelled services due to damage or system faults. Friday will see significant disruption for travellers wishing to travel on the London Euston and Watford Junction lines with services expected to be up and running by the end of the day. In Wales, the aftermath of the recent severe weather will see rail services hampered until Monday. Ferry services also experienced cancellations and delays due to storm activity with operator DFDS confirming sailings between Dover and France were delayed due to strong winds in the English Channel. Air travel in and out of the UK saw cancellations but most services have returned to normal. The Met Office reported the worst of Storm Gerrit had passed with the last few days of 2023 forecast to be unsettled with strong winds, rain and even snow on higher ground. Met Office chief forecaster Steven Ramsdale said: ‚ÄúHeavy rain will spread across all but the far north on Saturday, affecting similar areas previously affected by Storm Gerrit. However, this rainfall will be a step down from that seen during Storm Gerrit.‚Äù

author: Marco Benedetto
title: Ges√π disse: ‚ÄúSe uno vuole essere il primo, sia l‚Äôultimo di tutti e il servitore di tutti‚Äù
text:
Ges√π disse: ‚ÄúSe uno vuole essere il primo, sia l‚Äôultimo di tutti e il servitore di tutti‚Äù
Pubblicato il 2 Giugno 2024 - 06:56
Ges√π disse: ‚ÄúSe uno vuole essere il primo, sia l‚Äôultimo di tutti e il servitore di tutti‚Äù. √à un tema che ritorna nella predicazione di Ges√π. Chi vuole essere primo si faccia ultimo, i primi in questo mondo sarnno ultimi nel Regno dei Cieli, se mai riusciranno a entrarci. Non avete meriti per chi siete e per quello che avete, √® solo un dono di Dio, e allora mettete quel che avete a disposizione di chi non ha.
Racconta il Vangelo di Marco (
Mc 9,30-37) che detto questo, Ges√π prese un bambino, lo pose in mezzo a loro e, abbracciandolo, disse loro: ‚ÄúChi accoglie uno solo di questi bambini nel mio nome, accoglie me; e chi accoglie me, non accoglie me, ma colui che mi ha mandato‚Äù.
Ges√π aveva chiesto agli apostoli: ‚ÄúDi che cosa stavate discutendo per la strada? ma essi tacevano. Per la strada infatti avevano discusso tra loro chi fosse pi√π grande. Sedutosi, chiam√≤ i Dodici e disse loro: ‚ÄúSe uno vuole essere il primo, sia l‚Äôultimo di tutti e il servitore di tutti‚Äù.
Ges√π disse anche: ‚ÄúChi sa fare il bene e non lo fa, commette peccato‚Äù. Lo riferisce nella sua lettera (Giac 4,13-17)
Giacomo, cui Ges√π affid√≤ la Chiesa, fino a quando giustiziarono anche lui, considerato fratello di Ges√π, di sangue o in spirito √® mteria di convinzioni religiose.
Riferisce Giacomo che Ges√π pronunci√≤ queste parole: ‚ÄúOra [mi rivolgo] a voi, che dite: ¬´Oggi o domani andremo nella tal citt√† e vi passeremo un anno e faremo affari e guadagni¬ª, mentre non sapete quale sar√† domani la vostra vita! Siete come vapore che appare per un istante e poi scompare.
Dovreste dire invece: ¬´Se il Signore vorr√†, vivremo e faremo questo o quello¬ª. Ora invece vi vantate nella vostra arroganza; ogni vanto di questo genere √® iniquo‚Äù.

author: PA News Agency
title: Venezuela to hold military exercises as British warship heads to Guyana | Salisbury Journal
text: President Nicolas Maduro has ordered Venezuela‚Äôs armed forces to conduct defensive exercises in the Eastern Caribbean after the UK sent a warship towards Guyana‚Äôs territorial waters as the South American neighbours dispute a large border region. In a nationally televised address on Thursday, Mr Maduro said 6,000 Venezuelan troops, including air and naval forces, will conduct joint operations off the nation‚Äôs eastern coast ‚Äî near the border with Guyana. Mr Maduro described the impending arrival of British ship HMS Trent to Guyana‚Äôs shores as a ‚Äúthreat‚Äù to his country. He argued the ship‚Äôs deployment violates a recent agreement between the South American nations. ‚ÄúWe believe in diplomacy, in dialogue and in peace, but no one is going to threaten Venezuela,‚Äù Mr Maduro said in a room where he was accompanied by a dozen military commanders. ‚ÄúThis is an unacceptable threat to any sovereign country in Latin America.‚Äù Venezuela and Guyana are involved in a border dispute over the Essequibo, a sparsely populated region the size of Florida with vast oil deposits off its shores. The region has been under Guyana‚Äôs control for decades. But in December, Venezuela relaunched its historical claim to the Essequibo through a referendum in which it asked voters in the country whether the Essequibo should be turned into a Venezuelan state. As tensions over the region escalated, the leaders of both countries met in the Caribbean island of St Vincent and signed an agreement which said they would solve their dispute through nonviolent means. During the talks, however, Guyana‚Äôs President Irfan Ali said his nation reserved its right to work with its partners to ensure the defence of his country. On Thursday, Guyanese officials described the visit of HMS Trent as a planned activity aimed at improving the nation‚Äôs defence capabilities and said the ship‚Äôs visit will continue as scheduled. ‚ÄúNothing that we do or have done is threatening Venezuela,‚Äù Guyana‚Äôs vice-president Bharrat Jagdeo told reporters in Georgetown, the nation‚Äôs capital. HMS Trent is a patrol and rescue ship that was recently used to intercept drug traffickers off the West Coast of Africa. It can accommodate up to 30 sailors and a contingent of 18 marines and is equipped with 30mm cannons and a landing pad for helicopters and drones. The ship had been sent to Barbados in early December to intercept drug traffickers, but its mission was changed on December 24, when it was sent to Guyana. Authorities did not specify when it was expected to arrive off Guyana‚Äôs shores. The UK‚Äôs Ministry of Defence said the ship would be conducting joint operations with Guyana‚Äôs defence forces. The nation of 800,000 people has a small military that is made up of 3,000 soldiers, 200 sailors and four small patrol boats known as Barracudas. Comments: Our rules We want our comments to be a lively and valuable part of our community - a place where readers can debate and engage with the most important local issues. The ability to comment on our stories is a privilege, not a right, however, and that privilege may be withdrawn if it is abused or misused. Please report any comments that break our rules. author: Brody Levesque
title: Bisexual former umpire sues Major League Baseball for sexual harassment
text:
A fired former umpire is suing Major League Baseball, claiming he was sexually harassed by a female umpire and discriminated against because of his gender and his sexual orientation.
Brandon Cooper worked in the minor league Arizona Complex League last year, and according to the lawsuit he filed Wednesday in federal court in Manhattan, he identifies as bisexual.
‚ÄúI wanted my umpiring and ability to speak for itself and not to be labeled as ‚ÄòBrandon Cooper the bisexual umpire,‚Äô‚Äù he told Outsports . ‚ÄúI didn‚Äôt want to be labeled as something. It has been a passion of mine to simply make it to the Major Leagues.‚Äù
But that didn‚Äôt happen. Instead of being promoted, he was fired. His suit names MLB and an affiliated entity, PDL Blue, Inc., and alleges he had endured a hostile work environment and wrongful termination and/or retaliation because of gender and sexual orientation under New York State and New York City law.
‚ÄúHistorically the MLB has had a homogenous roster of umpires working in both the minor and major leagues,‚Äù Cooper claims in his suit. ‚ÄúSpecifically, to date there has never been a woman who has worked in a (regular) season game played in the majors, and most umpires are still Caucasian men. To try to fix its gender and racial diversity issue, defendants have implemented an illegal diversity quota requiring that women be promoted regardless of merit.‚Äù
Cooper claims former umpire Ed Rapuano, now an umpire evaluator, and Darren Spagnardi, an umpire development supervisor, told him in January 2023 that MLB had a hiring quota, requiring that at least two women be among 10 new hires.
According to the suit, Cooper was assigned to spring training last year and was notified by the senior manager of umpire administration, Dusty Dellinger, that even though he received a high rating in June from former big league umpire Jim Reynolds, now an umpire supervisor, that women and minority candidates had to be hired first.
Cooper claims that upon learning Cooper was bisexual, fellow umpire Gina Quartararo insulted him and fellow umpire Kevin Bruno by using homophobic slurs and crude remarks. At that time, Quartararo and Cooper worked on the same umpiring crew and being evaluated for possible promotion to the big leagues.
This season, Quartararo is working as an umpire in the Florida State League, one of nine women who are working as minor league umpires.
Cooper said he notified Dellinger, but instead of taking action against Quartararo, he said MLB ordered Cooper to undergo sensitivity training. According to his lawsuit, he was also accused of violating the minor league anti-discrimination and harassment policy.
Cooper‚Äôs suit says he met with MLB Senior Vice President of Diversity, Equity and Inclusion Billy Bean ‚Äî who the Los Angeles Blade reported in December is battling cancer.
The lawsuit says at that meeting, Bean told the umpire that Quartararo claimed she was the victim, as the only female umpire in the ACL. Cooper said he told Bean Quartararo regularly used homophobic slurs and at one point physically shoved him. He also claims that he has video evidence, texts and emails to prove his claim.
But he said his complaints to Major League Baseball officials were ignored. His lawsuit said MLB passed him over for the playoffs and fired him in October. He said of the 26 umpires hired with Cooper, he was the only one let go.
Through a spokesperson, MLB declined to comment on pending litigation. Quartararo has also not publicly commented on the lawsuit.

author: Alejandro Peinado
title: Un Atl√©tico de doble cara tumba a un rocoso Leipzig e inicia la nueva Champions con victoria
text:
En el Metropolitano estuvo cerca de vivirse un d√©j√† vu. El de Dortmund , cuando el Atl√©tico claudic√≥ y cay√≥ eliminado en su √∫ltimo partido europeo hasta la fecha. Seis meses despu√©s, desprecint√≥ la nueva Champions del mismo modo que cerr√≥ la antigua, con un equipo alem√°n delante y un gol abajo a las primeras de cambio. Aunque en esta ocasi√≥n, el desenlace fue distinto. Griezmann primero y Gim√©nez sobre la bocina revirtieron la situaci√≥n. [As√≠ hemos vivido la victoria del Atl√©tico] .
Cuando se consigue algo a trav√©s de la v√≠a del sufrimiento, sabe mejor. Ese fue el camino elegido por el Atl√©tico de Madrid ante el Leipzig. Un sendero que arranc√≥ sinuoso, con curvas demasiado pronunciadas. El partido fue cogiendo ritmo hasta convertirse en un ida y vuelta en los primeros minutos. Parec√≠a el tramo final del partido, pero no se hab√≠an cumplido ni cinco minutos cuando Openda fusil√≥ a Oblak , que sac√≥ una mano milagrosa, y Sesko recog√≠a el rechace para adelantar a su equipo.
Mala transici√≥n defensiva rojiblanca, peor presentaci√≥n a un bal√≥n suelto. De pronto, los de Simeone se hund√≠an en un mar inundado de imprecisiones y mala ocupadi√≥n de los espacios. Con un peso, el tanto de Sesko, atado en el tobillo. Lastre que hizo crecer la incertidumbre. Gim√©nez dudaba si mantener la posici√≥n o subir la l√≠nea.
ùëµùíñùíèùíÑùíÇ ùíÖùíÜùíãùíÜùíî ùíÖùíÜ ùíÑùíìùíÜùíÜùíì... ü§ç‚ù§Ô∏è
Gim√©nez desata la locura en el Metropolitano. @JoseMaGimenez13 @Atleti #UCL #LaCasaDelF√∫tbol pic.twitter.com/1TJiSHsmDg
‚Äî F√∫tbol en Movistar Plus+ (@MovistarFutbol) September 19, 2024 Misma zozobra sent√≠a Reinildo , a medio camino entre defender y atacar. La tormenta se desataba en Madrid. El Leipzig, con mejor puesta en escena, muy c√≥modo sobre el terreno de juego. Con Vermeeren , exrojiblanco, compartiendo la sala de m√°quinas con un omnipresente Haidara . El belga dej√≥ una actuaci√≥n de buenas prestaciones. Una hora de funci√≥n en el Metropolitano, donde ya ha sido titular con el Leipzig las mismas veces que con el Atl√©tico.
Tiempo del que nunca goz√≥ con la camiseta rojiblanca porque ya saben, cuando con Simeone es no, es no. El compa√±ero de Vermeeren en la medular, Haidara, jugaba con cuatro pulmones. Se intentaba estirar el Atl√©tico, con m√°s problemas en la salida de bal√≥n que un ni√±o de primaria en clase de matem√°ticas. Los rojiblancos se ve√≠an en un espejo del pasado.
Griezmann y Koke celebran el gol del Atl√©tico. EFE.
El Leipzig exhib√≠a las cualidades que encumbraron a los mejores equipos de Simeone. Organizaci√≥n atr√°s y mordiente arriba. Dos patrones tan cl√°sicos como efectivos. Comenzaron a tambalearse con la actuaci√≥n de Correa . Microondas de r√°pido funcionamiento cuando act√∫a de revulsivo, fue el primer rojiblanco entrar en calor. Comenz√≥ el Atl√©tico a llegar ante Gulacsi .
La m√°s clara, la tuvo el argentino, pero la tecnolog√≠a le neg√≥ el gol. Su remate se pase√≥ por la l√≠nea de gol sin que la pulsera le pitara al √°rbitro. Comenza a hundirse atr√°s toda la fortaleza alemana arriba una vez pasado el agobio colchonero. Los de Simeone empezaron a llegar con facilidad, abrazados a sus jugadores habilidosos. Llorente dejaba la marca de los neum√°ticos en cada galopada.
√âxtasis final Correa danzaba sobre una baldosa y Griezmann daba sentido a todo lo anterior. Fue en una de esas arrancadas por la autopista Llorente desde donde lleg√≥ el empate. Marcos centro de primeras y Antoine , seg√∫n le ven√≠a fusil√≥ a Gulacsi con la pierna menos buena y restituy√≥ las tablas. Se tomaba un respiro el Leipzig que pasaba a ser el agobiado en lugar de agobiante.
Y como lo √∫nico que pasaba era el tiempo, Simeone agit√≥ el avispero en busca de alguna picadura. Su equipo todav√≠a hac√≠a la digesti√≥n de los √∫ltimos cambios cuando Griezmann centr√≥, Gim√©nez remat√≥ y el Metropolitano estall√≥. Remontada sobre la bocina. Triunfo con goles de los de siempre, para los que no pasan los formatos. El Atl√©tico aplaca con dos paraguazos la tormenta desatada por el Leipzig.
Lo m√°s le√≠do Yolanda D√≠az pide reducir el IVA a las peluquer√≠as y que lo paguen los "colegios...

'Fiesta' defiende a su equipo ante las cr√≠ticas recibidas por su reportaje: "No...
